    Random Forest
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int C
      the number of categorical responses of the data (the classes, the "Y" values) - set this before beginning the forest creation
      static int M
      the number of attributes in the data - set this before beginning the forest creation
      static int Ms
      Of the M total attributes, the random forest computation requires a subset of them to be used and picked via random selection.

    • Field Detail

      • C

        public static int C
        the number of categorical responses of the data (the classes, the "Y" values) - set this before beginning the forest creation

      • M

        public static int M
        the number of attributes in the data - set this before beginning the forest creation

      • Ms

        public static int Ms
        Of the M total attributes, the random forest computation requires a subset of them to be used and picked via random selection. "Ms" is the number of attributes in this subset. The formula used to generate Ms was recommended on Breiman's website.

      • RandomForest

                    java.lang.String modelFileName)
        Initializes a Random forest creation
        Parameters:
        numTrees - the number of trees in the forest
        data - the training data used to generate the forest
        //buildProgress - records the progress of the random forest creation

      • Evaluate

        public int Evaluate(int[] record)
        Evaluates an incoming data record. It first allows all the decision trees to classify the record, then it returns the majority vote
        Parameters:
        record - the data record to be classified

      • FindMaxIndex

        public static int FindMaxIndex(int[] arr)
        Given an array, return the index that houses the maximum value
        Parameters:
        arr - the array to be investigated
        Returns:
        the index of the greatest value in the array

        Attempt to abort random forest creation
